title: Can I write my novel in simple English? - Quora

response.answer_text: Read this: “I woke up from my comfort of existence and directed my being into that realm which contained the source of all fuels required for the growth of a cellular being, without which failure of senses was eminent“. What I meant to say was “I woke up from my chair and headed to the kitchen, where the food was, without which I would faint.” The idea here is not to use complex terms or sentences to impress the audience or make them reach out for a thesaurus. The idea is to write what is on your mind. A good editor will help you polish it further. Go on. Write that novel. All the best :-) ~ AJ

Of course you can! I’ll give you the best example. Sudha Murty, one of the most famous children’s literature author writes all of her books using the simplest of English. It is not your vocabulary which defines your work. It is the implication of the idea behind it.

Hi, Yes, you can write your novel in simple English. Most of the childern’s books are extremely simple and just need a good story. Just make sure you have a solid plot and amazing characters. Hope this helps!
Yup, you can write a novel in simple English. By simple English, what I mean is no heavy phrases or super formal words. You should use good vocabulary and be linguistic.
